senses.de: A place where two things join together
senses.ex: The knee is a joint in the human body.

Tips.title: Physical connections
Tips.description: The 'joint' refers to the point where bones meet or parts attach.
Tips.example: After a long run, his ankle joint was sore.

Tips.title: Mechanical context
Tips.description: 'Joint' is often used in construction and mechanics, relating to the assembly of structures.
Tips.example: The carpenter secured the joint between the two planks.

senses.de: Shared or done by two or more people
senses.ex: We are on a joint mission to finish the project.

Tips.title: Shared responsibility
Tips.description: When 'joint' describes an action, it means two or more parties equally share responsibility or participation.
Tips.example: They have joint ownership of the car.

Tips.title: Legal agreements
Tips.description: 'Joint' can be important in legal and financial contexts, indicating shared rights or obligations.
Tips.example: The divorced parents had joint custody of their children.

senses.de: A place where people gather, especially to eat, drink or for entertainment. Particularly refers to a disreputable place
senses.ex: We had dinner at Joe's, a popular local joint down the street.

Tips.title: Casual establishments
Tips.description: In casual language, 'joint' can mean a relaxed, informal place, often a bar or a restaurant.
Tips.example: Let's grab a bite at that pizza joint.

Tips.title: Not upscale
Tips.description: A 'joint' typically refers to a non-fancy place, not a high-end establishment.
Tips.example: This burger joint has the best fries in town.

senses.ex: John rolled a joint and passed it around.

Tips.title: Slang for marijuana
Tips.description: In slang, 'joint' is another word for a hand-rolled marijuana cigarette.
Tips.example: At the party, someone was passing a joint.

Tips.title: Informal use
Tips.description: Be aware 'joint' for a marijuana cigarette is informal and might not be understood in formal contexts.
Tips.example: He joked about rolling a joint, which wasn't appropriate during the meeting.

Articulate.wordDefinition:
Articulate refers to the act of speaking clearly and coherently, while the word joint refers to a connection point between bones in the body, or a physical junction or connector between two things.

Articulate would be applicable when referring to someone's ability to communicate effectively with words, whether it be in written or oral form.

Connection.wordDefinition:
Connection refers to linking two or more things together.

It is used when you are describing the relationship between things or how they are related to each other. For example, you might say that there is a connection between exercise and good health.

The word joint refers to a specific type of connection.

Connection refers to a general relationship between things, while joint specifically refers to a physical connection between two things.

Couple.wordDefinition:
Couple refers to two things or people that are seen as a pair or connected to each other, usually in a romantic or intimate way.

For example, a couple can refer to a man and a woman in a committed relationship.

Couple refers to a pair or connected individuals, usually romantically or intimately, while joint refers to something shared by two or more parties.

Hinge.wordDefinition:
Both words, hinge and joint, refer to a place where two things meet and can move together.

A hinge is a type of joint that allows for movement in only one direction, like a door hinge that only swings open and closed.

Hinges are mainly used to connect two objects and allow one to move in relation to the other.

In summary, hinges are a type of joint that allow movement in one direction, while joints are a more general term that can allow movement in many directions.

Hinges are mainly used for doors and gates, while joints are found in our bodies, machines, and many other objects.

Junction.wordDefinition:
Junction refers to a point where two or more things meet or join together, such as a road junction where two or more roads intersect.

Junction can also refer to a point where two or more electrical circuits connect.

Joint describes a specific anatomical feature in the body or a connection between two objects or materials, while junction describes a point where two or more things meet or connect.

Link.wordDefinition:
Link refers to a connection between two or more things that may not necessarily be physical.

Link can refer to a connection between ideas or information, such as a link between two websites on the internet or a link between two historical events.

Link is usually used when referring to a more abstract or conceptual connection between things.

So, in simple terms, joint is used for physical connections while link is used for more abstract connections.

Pivot.wordDefinition:
A pivot is a specific type of joint that allows rotation around a single axis. Pivots are commonly used in machinery and tools, such as the axle of a car or the pin on a compass.

A joint is a general term for a connection between two or more parts that allows movement, while a pivot is a specific type of joint that allows rotation around a single axis.

Seam.wordDefinition:
A seam is a line where two pieces of fabric or other material are sewn or joined together.

Joint refers to a connection between two things, while seam refers to a line where two pieces of material are sewn or joined together.

videos.Text: Cancer may kill you, but when you look at the numbers, arthritis ruins more lives. Assuming you live a long life, there's a 50 percent chance you'll develop arthritis. And it's not just aging that causes arthritis. Common injuries can lead to decades of pain, until our joints quite literally grind to a halt.

quotes.Text: You see that the people who are drawn to alternative medicine are often fairly healthy and they go to alternative medicine for what I call the 'symptoms of life.' Fatigue, joint pains, inability to concentrate, perhaps, the kinds of things that anyone over twenty-five gets at some point.
quotes.Title: American Editor
quotes.Name: Marcia Angell

quotes.Text: I'm a big fan of doing 'Triple D.' But I don't want to do it forever, don't get me wrong! Travel away from my family, are you crazy? But do you know what it does for these mom-and-pop restaurant joints? It changes their lives forever. I mean, their businesses will never be the same.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Guy Fieri

quotes.Text: We've got to be fair. You can't say a place that has strip joints is sacred ground. We've got to be just. We've got to speak the truth. We've got to have justice for everybody. We're a country of justice for all, not justice for non-Muslims only or some groups and not for others.
quotes.Title: Egyptian Theologian
quotes.Name: Feisal Abdul Rauf

quotes.Text: My father wasn't a very good lawyer. He thought the law was sacred and something that was meant to help people. He didn't charge people like he should have... which is why I was allowed to play bars and strip joints when I was 14.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Max Weinberg

quotes.Text: I will not do a role that I don't think I can do, that I'm not interested in, where there's no humanity, that doesn't have any kind of handle for me at all because I know I'll just stink the joint up.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Ron Perlman

quotes.Text: My job as a surgeon is not just to fix a joint, but to give my patients the encouragement and tools they need to speed up their recovery and leave my clinic better than they have been in years.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Kevin R. Stone

quotes.Text: My parents-in-law, brother-in-law and everyone else are so fond of my son, Kabir. I believe raising him in a joint family set-up will make him more mature and caring.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Amrapali Gupta

quotes.Text: Don't get me wrong, there are sometimes if I go and see a really funny comedy, that I wished I had smoked a joint. I'll be honest with you. That's the truth.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Stephen Baldwin

quotes.Text: I think everyone knows how much of a joint effort being in politics is. It requires all kinds of sacrifices and all kinds of support.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Kerry Healey

quotes.Text: I should be paid to go out. You see, I'm good for business. I class up a joint.
quotes.Title: American Poet
quotes.Name: Rene Ricard
